page.title: 14The Spa
page.content: The Spa is a complex of buildings that includes a theatre, concert/conference hall, exhibition halls, bars, cafe and cloakrooms. The whole structure is undergoing a programme of {modernisation}and{redecoration}in order to improve the facilities and attract more{conferences}to the town. The Spa is situated on the southern half of Scarborough's South Bay and has a pleasant view across the bay towards the old town and harbour. There has been an improvement in parking facilities and access to hotels on the South Cliff above the Spa is easy via the Cliff Lift. The discovery of a Medicinal Spa on this site in the 17th century was the original attraction to Scarborough as a resort. This aspect of the Spa is totally neglected today and the spring issuing from the sea wall is ignored.
